thread.section_title: Avas Flowers Reviews | Customer Service Reviews of Avas Flowers | avasflowers.com
thread.title: Mj Clement
thread.title_full: Avas Flowers reviewed by Mj Clement

author: Mj Clement
title: Mj Clement
text: If you are fine with Avis sending whatever is available from the florist that makes up the delivery and not anything that resembles the arrangement you wanted, then this is a great place to order from. I wanted to get a tulip only arrangement that was featured on the Avis website. Their website even said if I ordered in the next 43 minutes they would waive the delivery charge. I got all the way to the point of paying, what I thought was the $64.99 tulip arrangement and although they waived the delivery fee they added a $13.48 Service fee. I called Avis and complained so they waived the Service Fee. I bought the arrangement in good faith that it would be similar to what I saw online. I was wrong. The friend I sent it to said it was full of greenery, spring flowers and 3 flower buds that had not opened. She didn't know it they were daffodils or tulips. I called Avis and they said it is in their policy that it can be a "Designer arrangement" instead of what you thought you saw online. I didn't read the fine print, so I lose but so do they because I won't buy from them again,
